Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window

Class BasicWindow

java.lang.Object
org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.core.SFMLNativeObject
org.jsfml.window.Window
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window.BasicWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
WindowStyle
Direct Known Subclasses:
org.jsfml.graphics.RenderWindow
public class BasicWindow extends org.jsfml.window.Window implements WindowStyle
A basic window that provides an OpenGL context. This class implements the WindowStyle interface for quick access to the constants provided by it.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject

    Fields inherited from interface com.rubynaxela.kyanite.window.WindowStyle

  • Method Details

    • isLegalWindowThread

      public static boolean isLegalWindowThread()
      Checks whether the current native thread is eligibile for creating a window. This will always be the case on Windows or Linux, but on Mac OS X, it will check whether the JVM was started in the main thread using the -XstartOnFirstThread command line parameter.
      Returns:
      true if the current native thread may create a window, false otherwise

    • create

      public void create(@NotNull @NotNull VideoMode mode, @NotNull @NotNull String title, int style, @NotNull @NotNull ContextSettings settings)
      Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened.
      Parameters:
      mode - the video mode that determines the window's size (must be a valid video mode in case WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN is set)
      title - the window title
      style - the style of the window
      settings - the context settings for the created OpenGL context.
      See Also:
      • VideoMode.isValid()
      • WindowStyle
      • ContextSettings

    • create

      public final void create(@NotNull @NotNull VideoMode mode, @NotNull @NotNull String title, int style)
      Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened. The default context settings will be used for the OpenGL context.
      Parameters:
      mode - the video mode that determines the window's size (must be a valid video mode in case WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN is set)
      title - the window title
      style - the style of the window
      See Also:
      • VideoMode.isValid()
      • WindowStyle

    • create

      public final void create(@NotNull @NotNull VideoMode mode, @NotNull @NotNull String title)
      Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened. The WindowStyle.DEFAULT window style will be applied and default context settings will be used for the OpenGL context.
      Parameters:
      mode - the video mode that determines the window's size
      title - the window title

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the window and destroys all attached resources, including the OpenGL context provided by it.
      Overrides:
      close in class org.jsfml.window.Window

    • isOpen

      public boolean isOpen()
      Checks if the window has been created and is opened. Note that the open state is not directly affected by the user clicking the window's close button, if available. In order to accomplish that, listen to an event of type Event.Type.CLOSED and use the close() method.
      Overrides:
      isOpen in class org.jsfml.window.Window
      Returns:
      true if the window has been created and is currently open

    • setVerticalSyncEnabled

      public void setVerticalSyncEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enables or disables vertical synchronization (VSync). Activating vertical synchronization will limit the number of frames displayed to the refresh rate of the monitor. This can avoid some visual artifacts, and limit the framerate to a good value (but not constant across different computers). This should not be used in combination with setFramerateLimit(int), as these two will conflict with one another. By default, vertical synchronization is disabled.
      Overrides:
      setVerticalSyncEnabled in class org.jsfml.window.Window
      Parameters:
      enable - true to enable vertical synchronization, false to disable

    • setMouseCursorVisible

      public void setMouseCursorVisible(boolean show)
      Determines whether the mouse cursor, if moved over the window, is visible or not
      Overrides:
      setMouseCursorVisible in class org.jsfml.window.Window
      Parameters:
      show - true to make the cursor visible, false to hide it

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible(boolean show)
      Shows or hides the window
      Overrides:
      setVisible in class org.jsfml.window.Window
      Parameters:
      show - true to show the window, false to hide it

    • setKeyRepeatEnabled

      public void setKeyRepeatEnabled(boolean enable)
      Determines whether automatic key repeat is enabled. If enabled, multiple key press events will be fired when a key stays pressed (much like in a text field). Key repeat is enabled by default.
      Overrides:
      setKeyRepeatEnabled in class org.jsfml.window.Window
      Parameters:
      enable - true to enable, false to disabled

    • display

      public void display()
      Flushes the OpenGL pixel buffer to the screen. This should be called every frame after everything has been drawn in order to make the changes visible in the window.
      Overrides:
      display in class org.jsfml.window.Window

    • setFramerateLimit

      public void setFramerateLimit(int limit)
      Sets the maximum frame rate in frames per second. If a limit is set, the display() method will blockfor a short delay time after flushing the buffer in order to possibly maintain a constant frame rate. This should not be used in combination with setVerticalSyncEnabled(boolean)} as these two will conflict with one another. By default, there is no frame rate limit.
      Overrides:
      setFramerateLimit in class org.jsfml.window.Window
      Parameters:
      limit - the maximum frame rate in frames per second, or 0 to disable the frame rate limit

    • getPosition

      public Vector2i getPosition()
      Gets the absolute position of the window's top left corner on the screen.
      Returns:
      the absolute position of the window's top left corner on the screen

    • pollEvent

      public Event pollEvent()
      Pops the event on top of the event stack, if any, and returns it. This method needs to be called regularly in order to process pending events. If this is not done, the window will be unresponsive
      Returns:
      the event currently on top of the event stack, or null if there is none.
      See Also:
      • waitEvent()

    • pollEvents

      public Iterable<Event> pollEvents()
      Returns an Iterable that consecutively calls pollEvent() and can be used to process all pending events.
      Returns:
      an Iterable over all pending events
      See Also:
      • pollEvent()

    • waitEvent

      public Event waitEvent()
      Pops the event on top of the event stack and returns it, or, if there is none, waits until an event occurs and then returns it. This method will block the program flow until an event is returned.
      Returns:
      the event currently on top of the event stack, or the next event that will occur
      See Also:
      • pollEvent()

    • setTitle

      public void setTitle(@NotNull @NotNull String title)
      Sets the window's title
      Parameters:
      title - the window's new title

    • setIcon

      public void setIcon(@NotNull @NotNull Image icon)
      Sets the icon of the window.
      Parameters:
      icon - the icon image.

    • setActive

      public void setActive(boolean active) throws ContextActivationException
      Activates or deactivates the window as the current OpenGL rendering target. If a window gets activated, all other windows operating in the same thread will automatically be deactivated.
      Parameters:
      active - true to activate, false to deactivate
      Throws:
      ContextActivationException - in case window activation fails

    • setActive

      public final void setActive() throws ContextActivationException
      Activates the window as the current OpenGL rendering target. If a window gets activated, all other windows operating in the same thread will automatically be deactivated.
      Throws:
      ContextActivationException - in case window activation fails.

    • setJoystickThreshold

      public void setJoystickThreshold(float threshold)
      Sets the joystick threshold. Joystick axis movements with a magnitude smaller than this treshold will not fire a joystick event. The default joystick treshold is 0.1.
      Parameters:
      threshold - the joystick threshold, ranging between 0 and 100
      See Also:
      • JoystickMoveEvent
